◆ AutoThreshold() [2/2]

static void BioGTK.BioImage.AutoThreshold ( BioImage  b,
bool  updateImageStats 
)
static

It takes a BioImage object, and calculates the mean histogram for each channel, and for the entire image.

The BioImage object is a class that contains a list of buffers, each of which contains a byte array of pixel data.

The function also calculates the mean histogram for each buffer, and stores it in the buffer's stats property.

The function also calculates the mean histogram for each channel, and stores it in the channel's stats property.

The function also calculates the mean histogram for the entire image, and stores it in the image's statistics property.

The mean histogram is calculated by adding up the histograms of each buffer, and then dividing by the number of buffers.

The histogram is calculated by looping through the byte array of pixel data, and incrementing the value of the histogram at the index of the pixel value.

The histogram

BioImageThis is the image object that contains the image data.
updateImageStatsif true, the image stats will be updated.

The OpenFile function opens a BioImage file, reads its metadata, and loads the image data into a BioImage object.

Parameters
fileThe file path of the bioimage to be opened.
seriesThe series parameter is an integer that specifies the series number of the image to open.
tabThe "tab" parameter is a boolean value that determines whether the BioImage should be opened in a new tab or not. If set to true, the BioImage will be opened in a new tab. If set to false, the BioImage will be opened in the current tab.
addToImagesA boolean value indicating whether the BioImage should be added to the Images collection.
tileThe "tile" parameter is a boolean value that determines whether the image should be opened as a tiled image or not. If set to true, the image will be opened as a tiled image. If set to false, the image will be opened as a regular image.
tileXThe tileX parameter is an integer that represents the starting X coordinate of the tile. It is used when opening a tiled image to specify the position of the tile within the image.
tileYThe tileY parameter is used to specify the starting Y coordinate of the tile when opening a tiled image. It determines the position of the tile within the image.
tileSizeXThe tileSizeX parameter is the width of each tile in pixels. It is used when opening a tiled TIFF image to specify the size of the tiles.
tileSizeYThe tileSizeY parameter is the height of each tile in pixels when the image is tiled.
Returns
The method is returning a BioImage object.

The function "OpenOME" opens a bioimage file, with options to specify the series, whether to

The function "OpenOME" opens a bioimage file, with options to specify the series, whether to display it in a tab, whether to add it to existing images, whether to tile the image, and the tile size.

Parameters
fileThe file parameter is a string that represents the file path or name of the OME (Open Microscopy Environment) file that you want to open.
serieThe "serie" parameter is an integer that represents the series number of the image to be opened.
tabThe "tab" parameter is a boolean value that determines whether the image should be opened in a new tab or not. If set to true, the image will be opened in a new tab. If set to false, the image will be opened in the current tab.
addToImagesThe "addToImages" parameter is a boolean value that determines whether the opened image should be added to a collection of images. If set to true, the image will be added to the collection. If set to false, the image will not be added.
tileThe "tile" parameter is a boolean value that determines whether or not to tile the images. If set to true, the images will be tiled according to the specified tilex, tiley, tileSizeX, and tileSizeY parameters. If set to false, the images will not be tiled.
tilexThe parameter "tilex" is an integer that represents the starting x-coordinate of the tile.
tileyThe parameter "tiley" is used to specify the number of tiles in the y-direction when tiling the image.
tileSizeXThe tileSizeX parameter specifies the width of each tile in pixels when tiling the images.
tileSizeYThe tileSizeY parameter is the height of each tile in pixels when tiling the images.

6021 if (tileSizeX == 0)

6030 if (b.meta == null)

6032 string f = file.Replace("\\", "/");

6034 if (cf != null)

6046 int RGBChannelCount = reader.getRGBChannelCount();
6047 //OME reader.getBitsPerPixel(); sometimes returns incorrect bits per pixel, like when opening ImageJ images.
6048 //So we check the pixel type from xml metadata and if it fails we use the readers value.
6049 PixelFormat PixelFormat;
6050 try
6051 {
6052 PixelFormat = GetPixelFormat(RGBChannelCount, b.meta.getPixelsType(serie));
6053 }
6054 catch (Exception)

6056 PixelFormat = GetPixelFormat(RGBChannelCount, reader.getBitsPerPixel());
6057 }

6059 b.id = file;
6060 b.file = file;

6063 SizeY = reader.getSizeY();

6075 //Lets get the channels and initialize them
6076 int i = 0;
6077 pr.Status = "Reading Channels";
6078 int sumSamples = 0;
6079 while (true)
6080 {
6081 Channel ch = new Channel(i, b.bitsPerPixel, 1);
6082 bool def = false;
6083 try
6084 {
6085 if (b.meta.getChannelSamplesPerPixel(serie, i) != null)
6086 {
6087 int s = b.meta.getChannelSamplesPerPixel(serie, i).getNumberValue().intValue();
6088 ch.SamplesPerPixel = s;
6089 sumSamples += s;
6090 def = true;
6091 }
6092 if (b.meta.getChannelName(serie, i) != null)
6093 ch.Name = b.meta.getChannelName(serie, i);
6094 if (b.meta.getChannelAcquisitionMode(serie, i) != null)
6095 ch.AcquisitionMode = b.meta.getChannelAcquisitionMode(serie, i).ToString();
6096 if (b.meta.getChannelID(serie, i) != null)
6097 ch.info.ID = b.meta.getChannelID(serie, i);
6098 if (b.meta.getChannelFluor(serie, i) != null)
6099 ch.Fluor = b.meta.getChannelFluor(serie, i);
6100 if (b.meta.getChannelColor(serie, i) != null)
6101 {
6102 ome.xml.model.primitives.Color cc = b.meta.getChannelColor(serie, i);
6103 ch.Color = Color.FromArgb(cc.getRed(), cc.getGreen(), cc.getBlue());
6104 }
6105 if (b.meta.getChannelIlluminationType(serie, i) != null)
6106 ch.IlluminationType = b.meta.getChannelIlluminationType(serie, i).ToString();
6107 if (b.meta.getChannelContrastMethod(serie, i) != null)
6108 ch.ContrastMethod = b.meta.getChannelContrastMethod(serie, i).ToString();
6109 if (b.meta.getChannelEmissionWavelength(serie, i) != null)
6110 ch.Emission = b.meta.getChannelEmissionWavelength(serie, i).value().intValue();
6111 if (b.meta.getChannelExcitationWavelength(serie, i) != null)
6112 ch.Excitation = b.meta.getChannelExcitationWavelength(serie, i).value().intValue();
6113 if (b.meta.getLightEmittingDiodePower(serie, i) != null)
6114 ch.LightSourceIntensity = b.meta.getLightEmittingDiodePower(serie, i).value().doubleValue();
6115 if (b.meta.getLightEmittingDiodeID(serie, i) != null)
6116 ch.DiodeName = b.meta.getLightEmittingDiodeID(serie, i);
6117 if (b.meta.getChannelLightSourceSettingsAttenuation(serie, i) != null)
6118 ch.LightSourceAttenuation = b.meta.getChannelLightSourceSettingsAttenuation(serie, i).toString();
6119
6120 }
6121 catch (Exception e)
6122 {
6123 Console.WriteLine(e.Message);
6124 }
6125 //If this channel is not defined we have loaded all the channels in the file.
6126 if (!def)
6127 break;
6128 else
6129 b.Channels.Add(ch);
6130 if (i == 0)
6131 {
6132 b.rgbChannels[0] = 0;
6133 }
6134 else
6135 if (i == 1)
6136 {
6137 b.rgbChannels[1] = 1;
6138 }
6139 else
6140 if (i == 2)
6141 {
6142 b.rgbChannels[2] = 2;
6143 }
6144 i++;
6145 }
6146 //If the file doens't have channels we initialize them.
6147 if (b.Channels.Count == 0)
6148 {
6149 b.Channels.Add(new Channel(0, b.bitsPerPixel, RGBChannelCount));
6150 }

6152 //Bioformats gives a size of 3 for C when saved in ImageJ as RGB. We need to correct for this as C should be 1 for RGB.
6153 if (RGBChannelCount >= 3)
6154 {
6155 b.sizeC = sumSamples / b.Channels[0].SamplesPerPixel;
6156 }
6157 b.Coords = new int[b.SizeZ, b.SizeC, b.SizeT];

6159 int resc = reader.getResolutionCount();
6160
6161 try
6162 {
6163 int wells = b.meta.getWellCount(0);
6164 if(wells>0)
6165 {
6166 b.Type = ImageType.well;
6167 b.Plate = new WellPlate(b);
6168 tile = false;
6169 }
6170 }
6171 catch (Exception)
6172 {
6173
6174 }
6175 List<Resolution> rss = new List<Resolution>();
6176 for (int s = 0; s < b.seriesCount; s++)
6177 {
6178 reader.setSeries(s);
6179 for (int r = 0; r < reader.getResolutionCount(); r++)
6180 {
6181 Resolution res = new Resolution();
6182 try
6183 {
6184 int rgbc = reader.getRGBChannelCount();
6185 int bps = reader.getBitsPerPixel();
6186 PixelFormat px;
6187 try
6188 {
6189 px = GetPixelFormat(rgbc, b.meta.getPixelsType(r));
6190 }
6191 catch (Exception)
6192 {
6193 px = GetPixelFormat(rgbc, bps);
6194 }
6195 res.PixelFormat = px;
6196 res.SizeX = reader.getSizeX();
6197 res.SizeY = reader.getSizeY();
6198 if (b.meta.getPixelsPhysicalSizeX(r) != null)
6199 {
6200 res.PhysicalSizeX = b.meta.getPixelsPhysicalSizeX(r).value().doubleValue();
6201 }
6202 else
6203 res.PhysicalSizeX = (96 / 2.54) / 1000;
6204 if (b.meta.getPixelsPhysicalSizeY(r) != null)
6205 {
6206 res.PhysicalSizeY = b.meta.getPixelsPhysicalSizeY(r).value().doubleValue();
6207 }
6208 else
6209 res.PhysicalSizeY = (96 / 2.54) / 1000;
6210
6211 if (b.meta.getStageLabelX(r) != null)
6212 res.StageSizeX = b.meta.getStageLabelX(r).value().doubleValue();
6213 if (b.meta.getStageLabelY(r) != null)
6214 res.StageSizeY = b.meta.getStageLabelY(r).value().doubleValue();
6215 if (b.meta.getStageLabelZ(r) != null)
6216 res.StageSizeZ = b.meta.getStageLabelZ(r).value().doubleValue();
6217 else
6218 res.StageSizeZ = 1;
6219 if (b.meta.getPixelsPhysicalSizeZ(r) != null)
6220 {
6221 res.PhysicalSizeZ = b.meta.getPixelsPhysicalSizeZ(r).value().doubleValue();
6222 }
6223 else
6224 {
6225 res.PhysicalSizeZ = 1;
6226 }
6227 }
6228 catch (Exception e)
6229 {
6230 Console.WriteLine("No Stage Coordinates. PhysicalSize:(" + res.PhysicalSizeX + "," + res.PhysicalSizeY + "," + res.PhysicalSizeZ + ")");
6231 }
6232 rss.Add(res);
6233 }
6234 }
6235 reader.setSeries(serie);

6237
6238 //We need to determine if this image is pyramidal or not.
6239 //We do this by seeing if the resolutions are downsampled or not.
6240 if (rss.Count > 1 && b.Type != ImageType.well)
6241 {
6242 if (rss[0].SizeX > rss[1].SizeX)
6243 {
6244 b.Type = ImageType.pyramidal;
6245 tile = true;
6246 //We need to determine number of pyramids in this image and which belong to the series we are opening.
6247 List<Tuple<int, int>> ims = new List<Tuple<int, int>>();
6248 int? sr = null;
6249 for (int r = 0; r < rss.Count - 1; r++)
6250 {
6251 if (rss[r].SizeX > rss[r + 1].SizeX)
6252 {
6253 if (sr == null)
6254 {
6255 sr = r;
6256 ims.Add(new Tuple<int, int>(r, 0));
6257 }
6258 }
6259 else
6260 {
6261 ims[ims.Count - 1] = new Tuple<int, int>(ims[ims.Count - 1].Item1, r);
6262 sr = null;
6263 }
6264 }
6265 if (ims[serie].Item2 == 0)
6266 {
6267 ims[serie] = new Tuple<int, int>(ims[serie].Item1, rss.Count);
6268 }
6269 for (int r = ims[serie].Item1; r < ims[serie].Item2; r++)
6270 {
6271 b.Resolutions.Add(rss[r]);
6272 }
6273 if (b.Resolutions.Last().PixelFormat == b.Resolutions.First().PixelFormat && rss.Last().PixelFormat != b.Resolutions.Last().PixelFormat)
6274 {
6275 b.Resolutions.Add(rss.Last());
6276 b.Resolutions.Add(rss[rss.Count - 2]);
6277 }
6278 }
6279 else
6280 {
6281 b.Resolutions.AddRange(rss);
6282 }
6283 }
6284 else
6285 b.Resolutions.AddRange(rss);
6286

7920 an.fillColor = Color.FromArgb(int.Parse(st[0]), int.Parse(st[1]), int.Parse(st[2]), int.Parse(st[3]));
7921 }
7922 else
7923 if (col == 18)
7924 {
7925 //FONTSIZE
7926 double s = double.Parse(val, CultureInfo.InvariantCulture);
7927 an.fontSize = (float)s;
7928 an.family = "Times New Roman";
7929 }
7930 col++;
7931 val = "";
7932 }
7933 else
7934 val += c;
7935 }
7936
7937 return an;
7938 }
